items.title: AirFly’s wireless headphone dongle adds volume controls and better sound
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Twelve South released the AirFly Pro 2 dongle for connecting wireless headphones to non-Bluetooth devices, priced at $59.99.
- Key upgrades include dedicated volume control buttons and a Qualcomm QCC3056 audio processor for improved sound quality and latency.
- Features faster pairing, multipoint connectivity for simultaneous audio streaming to two headphones, and 25 hours of battery life.

items.title: Otter’s new AI agent can speak up in meetings
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Otter launches a voice-activated AI Meeting Agent for assistance during calls and meetings.
- The Meeting Agent answers questions using company data and can schedule meetings or draft emails.
- Currently available on Zoom, with upcoming support for Microsoft Teams and Google Meet.
- Otter introduces a Sales Agent for live coaching during calls, and an SDR Agent for autonomous product demos.
- Future Agents for marketing, recruiting, and other functions are planned.

items.title: Waymo plans robotaxi launch in Washington, DC in 2026
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo will launch its Waymo One ridehailing service in Washington, DC in 2026, pending legal changes for fully autonomous vehicles.
- Current city law requires human drivers for testing autonomous vehicles, prompting advocacy for legal amendments.
- Waymo's vehicles have been spotted in DC since last year, focusing on neighborhoods like Dupont Circle, Foggy Bottom, and Penn Quarter.
- The service aims to operate amid one of the worst traffic congestions in the US, with no details on vehicle numbers provided yet.
- Waymo currently operates driverless ridehailing in cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, and plans further expansions.

items.title: Nvidia’s AI assistant is here to optimize your gaming PC
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s AI assistant, G-Assist, was initially an April Fools’ prank in 2017, evolved into a tech demo, and is now fully functional for RTX GPU owners.
- G-Assist helps optimize game and system settings, measures frame rates, and controls lighting on connected devices.
- Users can interact with G-Assist via voice or text prompts, asking questions to receive detailed AI-generated responses.
- The assistant analyzes PCs for performance improvements and can provide recommendations on settings like overclocking and resolution adjustments.
- Requires a minimum of 12GB VRAM and nearly 10GB of local storage for the AI functions, supporting RTX 30-, 40-, and 50-series GPUs.
- Available through an update to the Nvidia app, which also introduces DLSS override options and display adjustments.

items.title: The FBI launched a task force to investigate Tesla attacks
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- The FBI has initiated a 10-person task force to investigate acts of vandalism and arson related to Tesla.
- The task force is also monitoring planned ‘Tesla Takedown’ protests scheduled for March 29, 2025.
- Incidents include finding incendiary devices at a Tesla showroom in Austin, Texas.
- Some acts are being described as domestic terrorism, influenced by statements from prominent figures including Elon Musk and former President Trump.
- There are concerns about increased surveillance authority for law enforcement over protestors due to the domestic terrorism designation.

items.title: Trump officials planned a military strike over Signal – with a magazine editor on the line
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- An editor from The Atlantic, Jeffrey Goldberg, was mistakenly added to a Signal group chat discussing military strikes on Yemen by Trump officials.
- The group chat included high-ranking members such as Vice President JD Vance and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, discussing upcoming attacks before they occurred on March 15th.
- The presence of the non-participant raised concerns about the security of discussions on classified military plans, which are not supposed to occur on consumer messaging apps like Signal.

items.title: Alleged Snowflake hacker agrees to be extradited to the US
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Connor Moucka, accused of stealing customer data from Snowflake, agreed to extradition to the US to face charges.
- Around 165 companies, including AT&T and Ticketmaster, were affected by the breaches.
- Moucka faces 20 charges, including violations of the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act, and allegedly collected $2.5 million in ransom.

items.title: Trump’s plans to save TikTok may fail to keep it online, Democrats warn
The best budget robot vacuums
Meta Quest might add single window screensharing in VR soon
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- A new "share" feature for Meta Quest VR headsets may allow users to share 2D window views with others in the virtual environment.
- The feature was spotted in the operating system's code, hinting at a tooltip text for sharing and unsharing capabilities.
- Currently, Meta Quest supports sharing VR and mixed-reality views, but not specific 2D windows.

items.title: You’ll soon be able to hear Apple Watch alarms even in silent mode
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple’s release candidate for watchOS 11.4 introduces a feature allowing alarms to be heard even in Silent Mode.
- Previously, the Apple Watch only provided haptic alerts in Silent Mode to maintain privacy.
- The new option, 'Break Through Silent Mode', will enable both sounds and vibrations for individual alarms, especially useful for waking up from sleep settings.
- This change addresses issues with missing alarms when Silent Mode is active, which many users, including the author, have experienced.

items.title: Best Early Deals from Amazon’s Spring Sales Event
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale begins on March 25 and runs until March 31, 2025.
- Discounts available on various items including gardening supplies, bedding, and tech gadgets.
- Some early deals include:
  - Google Pixel Tablet for $279
  - Blink Mini security camera for $20
  - Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones for $250
  - iRobot Roomba Combo i5 for $199
- Most deals do not require a Prime subscription, allowing wider access to discounts.
- Additional recommendations include:
  - Beats Studio Pro headphones on sale for $179.95
  - Amazon Fire HD 10 tablet starting at $94.99

Sony’s WH-1000XM5 wireless headphones are now available for $150 less
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- The Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are on sale for $249.99, $150 off their regular price of $399.99, at Target for Target Circle members.
- Available in midnight blue for $328.99 on Amazon and other colors for $329.99 at Best Buy, indicating a discount of about $70.
- The headphones are praised for refined design, improved sound quality, and better active noise cancellation (ANC) compared to their predecessors, though they do not fold for easy storage.

Alienware’s AW2725DF OLED gaming monitor is a steal at $599.99
How to delete your 23andMe data
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- 23andMe filed for bankruptcy, raising concerns about data management.
- Users can currently access and delete some of their data during Chapter 11 proceedings.
- Complete deletion of the account will result in loss of access and some data may still be retained for legal reasons.
- Steps to delete include logging into the account, verifying age, and confirming deletion via email.
- Personal data scrambling before deletion is suggested but may not be effective if data requirements are unclear.
- Deleted samples will be destroyed, though information from scientific studies will remain in use if previously consented to.

items.title: Google Drive for Windows on Arm PCs is now widely available
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google has launched its Drive app for Arm-compatible Windows PCs, previously in beta since last year.
- The app allows Windows PCs with Qualcomm’s Snapdragon processors to store, sync, and access files.
- Available exclusively for devices running Windows 11 with Microsoft WebView 2.
- Users downloaded as beta will be prompted to upgrade to the latest version from the Google Drive website.
- The launch supports increased adoption of apps on Arm64, including Google Chrome and NordVPN.

items.title: Aura digital photo frames will continue to auto-sync with Google Photos after all
Minecraft is getting vibrant with its visuals
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Mojang announced a new update called [Vibrant Visuals](https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/minecraft-vibrant-visuals) for Minecraft during the Minecraft Live event.
- The update will include dynamic lighting, improved shadows, enhanced water reflections, volumetric fog, and changes to underwater visuals.
- It will be a toggle-able feature for all players in Minecraft: Bedrock Edition and is currently in the testing phase, with plans for a rollout on Java Edition soon.

items.title: Microsoft announces security AI agents to help overwhelmed humans
Apple’s The Studio spins Hollywood chaos into comedic gold
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- *The Studio*, a comedy series by Apple TV Plus, features Seth Rogen, Evan Goldberg, and others as co-creators.
- The show satirizes Hollywood's absurdity through its protagonist Matt Remick, played by Rogen, who navigates the chaos in a film studio.
- Premiering on March 26th, the series boasts celebrity cameos and blends humor with a serious reflection on the film industry.

items.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle arrives on PS5 in April
Rivian now has a bedroom to go with its kitchen
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Rivian and iKamper have launched the Skycamp Mini tent for the R1T electric truck.
- The tent costs $4,595 and fits over the truck’s bed rack, designed to save storage space.
- Skycamp Mini is more aerodynamically friendly than other tents like the CyberTent, preserving electric range.
- The tent includes a deluxe self-inflating mattress and locking crossbar brackets for security.
- Available for order directly from iKamper's website, with a promo offering a “Disco Series” stove through April 15.

items.title: Splice CEO Kakul Srivastava on where to draw hard lines around AI in music
Apple’s AirPods Max with USB-C will soon support lossless audio
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Apple is introducing lossless audio support for AirPods Max in April.
- The headphones, which transitioned to USB-C, previously lacked wired audio playback.
- Users can enjoy 24-bit, 48 kHz lossless audio with the new update, enhancing music, movies, and gaming experiences.
- The update includes ultra low latency features, improving usability for music production and gaming.
- The firmware update will coincide with the launch of iOS 18.4, iPadOS 18.4, and macOS Sequoia 15.4 in April.

items.title: GoPro’s anamorphic lens is fun, fuss-free, and now available to buy
23andMe files for bankruptcy as CEO steps down
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- DNA testing company 23andMe has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to facilitate a sale.
- CEO Anne Wojcicki has resigned to become an independent bidder; interim CEO appointed is Joe Selsavage.
- Company was valued at $6 billion in 2021 but is now worth only $50 million, with ongoing operational and financial challenges.
- 23andMe recently settled a $30 million lawsuit over a data breach affecting nearly seven million customers in 2023.
- The company plans to continue operations and maintain customer access to data during bankruptcy proceedings.

items.title: Google is rolling out Gemini’s real-time AI video features
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Gemini can ‘see’ screens and camera feeds in real-time for some Google One AI Premium subscribers now.
- The rollout includes features demonstrated in Google’s ‘Project Astra’ last year.
- Users report that the feature is available on their devices, with live video interpretation and screen-reading capabilities.
- This rollout signifies Google's lead in the AI assistant market amid competition from Amazon's Alexa and Apple's Siri.

items.title: Google confirms it deleted Maps Timeline data for some
The Apple Watch may get cameras and Apple Intelligence
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple is planning to release camera-equipped AI wearables by 2027.
- According to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, cameras will be positioned inside the display for standard Series Watch and on the side for Apple Watch Ultra.
- New Visual Intelligence features will enable the watch to recognize the outside world and provide relevant information stemming from similar functionalities used in iPhone 16.
- The launch of these devices is part of Apple’s broader move into AI, with in-house models expected to support these features by 2027.

items.title: Why Balatro’s developer stays anonymous
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Balatro won four Game Developers Choice Awards, including Game of the Year, but its developer, LocalThunk, remained anonymous.
- Playstack's team accepts awards on LocalThunk's behalf to allow him the freedom to work privately.
- Balatro has sold over 5 million copies since its launch after a series of successful demos and is also available on mobile platforms.
- LocalThunk prefers to remain out of the spotlight and communicates efficiently with his team about his projects.

items.title: An old smartwatch favorite makes a comeback
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Core 2 Duo smartwatch, inspired by Pebble, is available for pre-order.
- Assassin’s Creed Shadows is a new game release, promising stunning graphics and gameplay.
- Day One journaling app now has a version for Windows.
- Google Pixel 9A is delayed due to hardware issues, but is expected to be a solid smartphone option.
- Tweek, a planner app, has improved its mobile interface.
- The Fujifilm GFX100RF camera combines compact design with advanced features, priced at $4,900.
- Mark Rober's video explores the challenges of fooling self-driving cars.

items.title: Is it safe to travel with your phone right now?
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Recent searches by airport Customs and Border Protection (CBP) have led to public concern, with travelers being denied entry based on phone content.  
- Notable incidents include a doctor deported for holding sympathetic content regarding Hezbollah and a French scientist denied entry for criticizing the Trump administration.  
- CBP device searches are rare, accounting for less than 0.01% of travelers in the 2024 fiscal year, but are increasing compared to previous years.  
- The Supreme Court allows warrantless searches at borders, complicating traveler rights regarding digital privacy, which differ based on immigration status.  
- Travelers should minimize data on devices and consider encryption, disabling biometric logins, and utilizing cloud backups for sensitive information to protect against searches.

items.title: Hue accidentally leaks a new video doorbell
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- An update to the Philips Hue app leaked a new Hue Secure video doorbell.
- The product features a straightforward design with a large button and is likely a wired device.
- Setup involves Bluetooth and Wi-Fi, and the camera is expected to launch in fall 2025, but details on pricing and specs are still unavailable.

items.title: Cloudflare is luring web-scraping bots into an ‘AI Labyrinth’
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Cloudflare has launched AI Labyrinth, a tool to combat web-scraping bots.
- The tool lures harmful crawlers into decoy pages to waste their resources.
- It identifies and fingerprints malicious bots to improve defenses.
- Website administrators can opt in via the Cloudflare dashboard.
- AI Labyrinth aims to develop networks of linked URLs to further trap bots.

items.title: Photo Mode is my new gaming obsession
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The author has become obsessed with photo modes in the games *Infinity Nikki* and *Assassin’s Creed Shadows* due to their detailed environments and textures.
- Photo mode allows players to capture professional-grade images, a feature that has gained prominence in modern gaming.
- Initially indifferent to photo modes, the author found satisfaction in experimenting with photo features in both games, leading to a newfound appreciation for video game photography.
- Key moments in the games prompted the author to capture images, reshaping their perception of photo mode from a trivial feature to a form of creative expression.
- The experience has motivated the author to improve their game photography skills, with aspirations to apply these skills in real life.

items.title: SwitchBot adds robot vacuums, smart shades, and its new Hub 3 to Home Assistant
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- SwitchBot will integrate over 45 products with Home Assistant in the first half of 2025.
- Notable new products include the SwitchBot Hub 3, Robot Vacuum K10 Plus Pro, and Curtain 3 smart shades.
- Many integrations are expected to roll out in April 2025.
- The integration is seen as beneficial for users as it enhances compatibility with various smart home devices amid challenges with undocumented software changes.

items.title: 7 cool indie games from GDC 2025
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The Game Developers Conference 2025 showcased unreleased indie games alongside major titles like Nintendo Switch 2 and Grand Theft Auto VI.
- Featured games include:
  - **Dreams of Another**: A shooter that creates the world instead of destroying it, featuring unique graphics and gameplay.
  - **Faraway**: A simple game where players, as a shooting star, create constellations with one-button gameplay.
  - **Haste: Broken Worlds**: A fast-paced roguelike game where players navigate procedurally generated levels.
  - **Herdling**: A herding game focused on guiding fluffy beasts through various environments.
  - **Hotel Barcelona**: A collaboration between game creators Suda51 and Swery65 offering a challenging roguelike horror experience.
  - **My Arms Are Longer Now**: A slapstick game where players use stretchy arms to steal items without detection.
  - **To a T**: A quirky game featuring a teenager stuck in a T-pose, exploring themes of identity and fears in a whimsical setting, set to release on May 28th.

items.title: The Best Laptops You Can Get
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Overall pick for most users is the [MacBook Air M4 model](https://www.theverge.com/reviews/627186/apple-macbook-air-m4-13-15-inch-2025-laptop-review) due to its portability and battery life.
- Alternatives include gaming laptops, Chromebooks, and unique models like the [16-inch MacBook Pro](https://www.theverge.com/24319419/apple-macbook-pro-m4-max-pro-review-price-specs).
- Criteria for good laptops include performance, solid build quality, battery life, and features like good keyboards and trackpads.
- The M4 MacBook Air is priced starting at $999 for the 13-inch and $1,199 for the 15-inch with better specs available at a higher price.

items.title: Fujifilm GFX100RF review: one sensor, nine cameras
items.author: David Imel
items.summary:
- Fujifilm GFX100RF aims to combine nine cameras and four lenses into one compact body with a 102MP sensor.
- Features an aspect ratio dial allowing selection from nine formats reminiscent of vintage film cameras.
- Virtual zoom capabilities offer four focal lengths: 35mm, 45mm, 63mm, and 80mm with reduced resolutions.
- The camera's compact design enhances portability but lacks in-body stabilization and has a minimum aperture of f/4.
- Price set at $4,899, making it the cheapest GFX body currently available, but not as fast or stabilized as competitors like the Leica Q3.

items.title: People keep putting fake walls in front of Teslas
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- YouTuber Mark Rober's fake wall test for Tesla FSD prompted a new video by Kyle Paul addressing FSD's obstacle detection capabilities.
- Paul's video features a Tesla Model Y with HW3 and a Cybertruck with HW4, testing FSD’s response to a Wile E. Coyote-style fake wall.
- The Model Y failed to detect the wall, while the Cybertruck successfully slowed down and stopped before hitting it.

The best MagSafe and Qi2 chargers
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Wireless charging offers convenience though it's generally less efficient than wired charging.
- Qi2 chargers are recommended for iPhones from the 12 series onwards, providing up to 15W charging, equivalent to MagSafe except for iPhone 16 which can charge at 25W.
- Qi2 is an open standard and typically less expensive than MagSafe options, with a wider range of chargers available.
- Samsung Galaxy S25 devices are Qi2 ready, requiring a special magnetic case to utilize the full charging speed on Qi2 chargers.
- Qi2 certification ensures proper charging performance and magnet alignment, replacing older MagSafe-compatible chargers.

items.title: Drama over quantum computing’s future heats up
items.author: Sophia Chen
items.summary:
- On March 18, Chetan Nayak of Microsoft presented quantum chip data at the American Physical Society summit amid ongoing skepticism.
- Microsoft claims a new topological qubit is less prone to errors, but researchers are doubtful of the evidence.
- Controversy stems from Microsoft's past retraction of similar claims and concerns over the timeline for useful quantum computing applications.
- Experts predict a decade before quantum computers become useful for practical applications, with current research focusing on reducing errors and scaling up qubits.
- Governments and private sectors are investing heavily in quantum technology, but overhype risks a potential 'quantum winter' due to inflated expectations.

items.title: The best iPad deals you can get
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Best iPad deals available outside major sales events like Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Ongoing discounts on various iPad models, including 10th-gen iPad, iPad Air, iPad Mini, and iPad Pro.

- New 2025 iPad models feature A16 and M3 chips with notable speed improvements and storage options.
- Discounts found at major retailers including Walmart, Amazon, and Best Buy.
